qas.question: What individual is the biggest shareholder on the Arsenal board?
What percentage of shares in Arsenal did Kroenke own by 2011?
Who is Kroenke's chief competitor for Arsenal stock?
In what year did Kreonke achieve take over of Arsenal stock?
Who was Arsenal's chief executive prior to 2009?
How many shares did Red and White Securities own of Arsenal in 2007?
In what month and year did David Dein acquire his shares in Arsenal?
In what country was Ivan Gazidis born?
In what year did Nina Bracewell-Smith and Danny Fiszman acquire their shares of Arsenal?

context: The largest shareholder on the Arsenal board is American sports tycoon <a0_0>Stan Kroenke<a0_0/>. Kroenke first launched a bid for the club in <b7_0>April 2007<b7_0/>, and faced competition for shares from Red and White Securities, which acquired its first shares off David Dein in August <b9_0>2007<b9_0/>. Red & White Securities was co-owned by <b8_0>Russian<b8_0/> billionaire Alisher Usmanov and Iranian London-based financier Farhad Moshiri, though Usmanov bought Moshiri's stake in 2016. Kroenke came close to the 30% takeover threshold in November 2009, when he increased his holding to 18,594 shares (29.9%). In <a4_0>April 2011<a4_0/>, Kroenke achieved a full takeover by purchasing the shareholdings of Nina Bracewell-Smith and Danny Fiszman, taking his shareholding to <a1_0>62.89%<a1_0/>. As of June 2015, Kroenke owns 41,698 shares (67.02%) and <a3_0>Red & White Securities<a3_0/> own <b6_0>18,695<b6_0/> shares (30.04%). <a2_0>Ivan Gazidis<a2_0/> has been the club's Chief Executive since <b5_0>2009<b5_0/>.
